result.execSummary:
The defendant Linda Drygalski Parrish was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Good faith effort at fulltime employment of at least 30 hours per week, or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 2:48 pm 
INCLUDES 20CM761, 20CM762, 21CM1147, 22CM477, 20TR1375, & 20TR1389. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Adam Nero. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.
State moves to: 
In 20CM761: Ct. 2>>DISMISS. 
In 20CM762: Ct. 1 (OWI 3rd)>>AMEND to OWI 4th pursuant to 346.63(1)(a)(4). 
                    : Ct. 2>>DISMISS. 
In 21CM1147: Ct. 1 (OWI 3rd)>>AMEND to OWI 5th pursuant to 346.63(1)(a)(5). 
                     : Cts. 2 & 3>>D&RI. 
In 22CM477: Cts. 1 - 3>>D&RI. 
In 20TR1375: Ct. 1>>DISMISS. 
In 20TR1375: Ct. 1>>DEEM REFUSAL LAWFUL.  
COURT grants above. 
State to efile amended complaints/informations. 

PLEA: 
In 20CM761: Ct. 1 (OWI 3rd)>>GUILTY. 
In 20CM762: Amended Ct. 1 (OWI 4th)>>GUILTY. 
In 21CM1147: Amended Ct. 1 (OWI 5th)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Argument: Def makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 20CM761: Ct. 1>>45 days MCJ; $600 plus costs; DNA sample/surcharge; 30 months dl revocation with admin credit; 30 months IID; alcohol assessment; 6 pts against dl. 

In 20CM762: Amended Ct. 1>>6 months MCJ; $600 plus costs; DNA sample/surcharge; 36 months dl revocation with admin credit; 36 month IID; alcohol assessment; 6 pts against dl. 

In 21CM1147: Amended Ct. 1>>6 yrs imprisonment - 2 yrs IC & 4 yrs ES - CONDITIONS OF ES>>Alcohol assessment (unless already done); mental health evaluation (unless already done); assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; good faith effort at fulltime employment of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; DNA sample/surcharge; $600 plus costs; 36 months dl revocation with admin credit; 36 months IID; 6 pts against dl. Def is eligible for SAP. Def is NOT eligible for CIP. 
 
COURT ORDERS sentences to run CONCURRENT to each other. 
COURT finds the def entitled to NO days jail credit at this time - attys to submit stipulation re: jail credit. 
Adj: 3:52 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
